author: megrimlance
title: Open Source Credential Wallet
description: No existe un monedero de identidad Atala Prism para almacenar y operar con Credenciales Verificables.

f6_assessments.q0: Esta es una propuesta que ha identificado un nicho (importante por cierto) y propone una gran solución de código abierto. Construir una cartera de identidad de código abierto que sea operativa con las identificaciones descentralizadas de Atala Prism y las credenciales verificables sería una forma increíble de acelerar la identidad descentralizada en la blockchain de Cardano. El hecho de que el equipo incluya a cuatro miembros de la primera cohorte del Programa Pionero de Atala Prism lo hace aún mejor. Para qué se preparan los pioneros de Atala Prism si no es para proyectos dirigidos por la comunidad como éste. El equipo hizo bien en poner en mayúsculas las palabras OPEN SOURCE en su propuesta de solución. Es una contribución clave que hará que el impacto sea aún mayor. Inicialmente, crearán un marco modular con los elementos básicos de un monedero de identidad para usuarios individuales. Esto significa que cualquiera podrá construirlo y ejecutarlo en un dispositivo móvil. Me gusta especialmente el hecho de que ya estén considerando un plan de desarrollo actualizado para proceder a futuros fondos.
f6_assessments.q1: Así se presentan las habilidades, la experiencia y los conocimientos técnicos. Si te gusta conocer a tu equipo de desarrolladores, esta es la forma de presentarlo. No voy a entrar en detalles, pero como ellos mismos afirman, tienen un total acumulado de 100 años de experiencia en el desarrollo de software. El desglose del presupuesto también incluye estimaciones de la velocidad de los desarrolladores (pico y media), así como una tasa de desarrollo para el presupuesto y un desglose preciso en 7 componentes (desde el diseño de la arquitectura hasta las pruebas generales y la depuración). Sí, el presupuesto está claramente esbozado y desglosado en partidas identificables y parece adecuado. Las credenciales del equipo parecen ser herméticas para un proyecto de esta envergadura, hay un total de 390 horas de trabajo evnisadas con una duración total de 13 semanas. La sartén no sólo es sensata, sino que el equipo garantizará la transparencia de las operaciones durante la ejecución gracias al componente de seguimiento del proyecto incorporado. Para mí es una luz verde.
f6_assessments.q2: Es realmente un placer revisar propuestas que son capaces de ampliar el alcance y proporcionar a los externos, no sólo una forma de entender lo que el equipo pretende lograr, sino también de verificar lo que se proponen entregar. Este equipo ha hecho un trabajo enorme: pensando, escribiendo, poniéndose en contacto con otros equipos y destilando su visión para garantizar la máxima claridad sobre los detalles y sobre la contribución general. La cartera de identidad de código abierto propuesta no es una simple cartera". El equipo ha expuesto sus funcionalidades previstas y lo que soportará el diseño: Funciones de monedero de identidad personalizables/ampliables, funciones de privacidad/seguridad, funciones de interfaz de usuario/usabilidad. El equipo ha enumerado con quiénes se han asociado para que la solución de cartera pueda servir a sus comunidades, clientes y desarrolladores. Han incluido una evaluación de riesgos y en términos de claridad y auditabilidad - se han proporcionado KPIs. Además, se pueden crear usuarios de Jira para el seguimiento y la capacidad de auditoría. Además, se publicarán informes quincenales con el progreso del proyecto, los principales hitos y la evaluación de riesgos. El progreso intermedio será reportado como Sprint Burndown, una métrica KPI que muestra el progreso de cada sprint de desarrollo. Además, el desarrollo se gestionará en un repositorio público de Github donde se empujarán commits periódicos y que permiten a la comunidad auditar y validar el trabajo. Qué puedo decir. Vaya.

f6_assessments.q0: Your idea proposal was interesting to read. Thank you for sharing. To make this proposal more relevant to the Cardano community, please consider the following suggestions: I suggest changing the idea description because it is essentially not clear and adds too much value to readers who are attempting to grasp its scope and purpose. It is not meant to be taken the wrong way, but clarifying the applicable use cases or giving more practical examples of what is the main value of an open-source credential wallet to different industries or to the overall Cardano community will be beneficial. Some ideas get into the execution phase if are more concentrated on adding value and value streams. Overall the idea is very good and the level of details shared was extremely positive and that's why the score will be high. Well done!
f6_assessments.q1: This proposal will be implemented successfully based on the experience and plans of the proposing team, though I suggest more information be included within the proposal regarding the relevant experience of the proposer in managing initiatives of this nature, as well as a more detailed plan and budget for the different tasks and activities described.
f6_assessments.q2: This proposal has value, and its implementation would have great benefits. If an open-source identity wallet that operates with Atala and verifiable credentials improves over time, more thought might need to be given to verifying ROI. I understand we need to work with these changes but also identify the life cycle of each technology implementation and the returns. In 5 years there may be a better deal in terms of power and performance than the current one. For the community to be educated about the use of funds in a sustainable, reasonable, and practical manner, both the advantages and disadvantages may need to be stated more clearly. But overall congratulations and well done with the idea proposed.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal creates an open source identity wallet, which interoperates with Atala PRISM and Verifiable Credentials.  While the campaign brief doesn't mention wallets or open source directly, it does mention key success metrics of production pilots and launches in 2022 and number of verifications performed.  The problem (a needed tool for DID development, the identity wallet) has a clear solution, to create the wallet.  If funded and completed, it will improve the metrics in the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: The team reads like a world championship of cardano DID. They have credentials and skills and present themselves professionally. The proposal is very clear, detailed and written for non-technical people to understand - while not leaving out the technical details.  The budget is clear and reasonable with a realistic timetable.  One highlight is the partnerships with the other DID proposers who would benefit from the open source wallet created.
f6_assessments.q2: The team will follow an industry standard management system for software development, Agile, which includes reporting progress, milestones and risk assessments.  This is a textbook 5 star proposal in my opinion. Godspeed, friends!

f6_assessments.q0: In order to be useful and accessible, the Verified Credentials issued using the Atala PRISM technology need to be stored, displayed, and verified using a wallet. This proposal therefore fills an important gap by outlining the creation of a wallet. All developers seeking to build solutions using PRISM technology would benefit from the implementation of this proposal. Furthermore, by ensuring that the code is open source, many others with complementary projects would benefit from the project as well. Providing open-source code also allows the project to scale even more easily.
f6_assessments.q1: The team clearly has extensive experience both in development and in the Cardano ecosystem. The fact that the team has a cumulative 100 years of software development experience is both impressive and easy for the reviewer to understand. In general, I commend the team for the very clear way this proposal was structured and written.  Additionally, the team has done a lot of groundwork to partner with other proposers in the challenge, who would clearly benefit from (and in fact require) this wallet in order for their projects to success.  The team has also had significant success with having past proposals funded, and experience developing large-scale collaborations with IOG. It is also highly relevant that the entire team has participated in the Atala PRISM pioneer program. The plan and budget seem well-thought out and reasonable.
f6_assessments.q2: The team provides a good outline for auditability metrics. They will use Sprint Burndown which will allow KPI-tracking for each development Sprint. Managing the development in a public Github repository also facilitates auditing. The team acknowledges the risk that the SDK is not yet public or final, and seems to have mitigated that risk appropriately through ongoing communications with the PRISM team.  The Roadmap (described as the Project Plan) is clear and the team has a clear and compelling vision for tying future phases of the project to the next Catalyst funding rounds.

f6_assessments.q0: Great initiative and approach to go for "The code will be open-source, and anyone will be able to build and run it on a mobile device." Cardano and wallet development community would re-cycle your team's open-source codes and packages output.
f6_assessments.q1: With your "Planed functionalities\Privacy / Security Features", it would be great if your team could add on one crucial security feature, whereas in a scenario if the smartphone-like device (phone/tablet or any device with SIM or E-SIM cards) being cloned or hacked, the wallet owner should be alert and disable or any type of hand-break to be activated to project any process requires DID's authorisation/authentication.
f6_assessments.q2: I believe in your team to deliver the project and possibly release the code design or detail comments of the code design along with the actual code, so any Cardano Atala PRISM enthusiastic developers make an accelerated start to drive on fast-paced cryptocurrency. This would be a massive credit to your four team members contribution.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposers wants to develop an Open Source identity wallet that operates with Atala Prism identity wallet available to store and operate with verifiable credentials. This falls within the Challenge Brief, to achieve full interoperability. This proposal will have a positive impact on the Cardano/Catalyst ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q1: The team's credentials are given, and explained. There is also links to their LinkedIn Accounts. They have extensive experience and will add great skills to the project. The Budget is set out and worked at an 100 USD/Hr rate. This seems reasonable. The proposer will need additional funding and will make use of future funds. They have a project plan set out with all the activities that needs attention and states that it will be over a period of 13 weeks. The resources and skills needed are discussed, and they have done a risk assessment.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposers will submit a bi-weekly report that will be published with project progress, major milestones and risk assessment.
Progress and success is measured when the wallet is complete.
Development will be managed in a public Github, that will allow the community to audit and validate progress. KPI's have also been listed and can also be used to track progress.

solution: Construiremos un monedero de identidad de código abierto que funcione con identificaciones descentralizadas y credenciales verificables de Atala Prism.
experience: El equipo está compuesto por cuatro miembros de la primera cohorte del Programa Prism Pioneer de Atala con una sólida experiencia en el desarrollo de software.
